sen.j: 著書は、徳川光圀から委嘱を受けた『万葉代匠記』をはじめ、『厚顔抄』、『古今余材抄』、『勢語臆断』、『源註拾遺』、『百人一首改観抄』、『和字正濫抄』など数多い。
sen.e: Keichu was a prolific writer, whose works included "Manyo Daishoki" (Commentary on Manyoshu [Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves]), which was entrusted with by Mitsukuni TOKUGAWA, "Kogan-sho" (literally, the book of temerity; Commentary on Verses in the "Kojiki" [A Record of Ancient Matter] and "Nihon shoki" [Chronicles of Japan]), "Kokin Yozai-sho" (Commentary on "Kokin Wakashu" which is also called "Kokin-shu" [Collection of Ancient and Modern poems"]), "Seigo Okudan" (Conjectures on Ise Monogatari [The Tales of Ise] in the light of Kokin-shu [an abbreviation of the "Kokin-shu"]), "Genchu Shui" (Addenda to Commentary on the Tale of Genji), "Hyakunin Isshu Kaikan-sho" (Rectified Commentary on the One Hundred Poets, One Poem Each Collection), and "Waji Shoran-sho" (Corrections to Errors in Japanese Characters).

sen.j: また、その学績は実証的学問法を確立して国学の発展に寄与し古典研究史上、時代を画するものであり、また後世の歴史的仮名遣いの成立に大きな影響を与えた。
sen.e: Keichu established an empirical study method, and his academic achievements contributed to the development of early modern Japanology (Kokugaku) and became a landmark of the history of the study on the Japanese classics, thus greatly influencing the establishment of old kana orthography of the posterity.
